-   Try to include each predator on its own in the models, do not pool them. If we have enough data of a species. If we have not enough data of species - pool them together as predators

-   test: activity (nr pictures) \~ season + covid + (presence of predator OR, if we have enough data, presence of fox + cat + marten + raccoon) + (1 \| ID camera trap)

    -   Presence of a predator/species: time after a squirrel visits a garden after a predator was there - night before

        -   night: 9pm-5am, day: 5am-9pm

        -   predator morning: 5am-9am

        -   include night + morning as different variables in the model. if that does not work, we try it in different models

-   test: time spent (maybe same as nr pictures) \~ minutes to sunrise + season + covid + presence of predator in the night/ or if there is enough data: presence of fox, cat, marten, raccoon) + presence of poredator in the morning + (1\|ID -- garden = camera trap ID)

-   time of delay (Julies Paper): Here, there should be an interval of at least 30 minutes between images of the same species.

    -   Analysis on a daily basis (reset on midnight)

    -   Squirrel - first species after the squirrel = time since predator

    -   Predator - squirrel = time to predator

    -   Squirrel - squirrel = Time to next squirrel, at least 30 minutes

    -   Model: time of delay \~ Fox + squirrel + marten + cat + raccoon + (1 \| ID camera trap)
